title: For Min. P, is the lake safe?

content.description: The number of gallons, P(t), of a pollutant in a lake changes at the rte P'(t) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn><msqrt> <mi>t</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> gallons per day, where t is measured in days. There are 50 gallons of the pollutant in the lake at time t = 0. The lake is considered to be safe when it contains 40 gallons or less of pollutant.
content.question: Is the lake safe when the number of gallons of pollutant is at its minimum? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Is the lake safe when the number of gallons of pollutant is at its minimum? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
